Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Derek and Colin,

I am concerned about your representing "presentation" inf=
ormation with your "structure" information.  Would it not be more effective=
 to have a second XML document detailing "presentation" details, and have t=
hat document "point" to the "structure" XML document?  That way, those who =
want to work strictly with data structure and have not care for the present=
ation, are not burdened with the presentation data.  Additionally, there wi=
ll be other types of presentation that will likely be created later.  I am =
assuming you would not want to add this presentation data to this XML, righ=
t?

I realize that right this second, that seems less efficient.  Later, it=
 is going to be much more noisy and much less efficient to have placed the =
presentation information in with the structure data.  Perhaps that can be a=
 step that is taken later.  I just thought it would be worth while to evalu=
ate that now, before too many lines of code are written dependent upon this=
 particular XML design.

You wrote:
> Just wondering...Colin and Ken have e=
xpressed an interest in using these tools.  Anyone else?

Once I am moving =
along with ANJI, I will certainly be interested in your presentation tools,=
 especially your SVG work.


Jim O'Flaherty, Jr.


  ----- Original Message=
 ----- 
  From: Derek James 
  To: neat@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, M=
arch 30, 2004 3:57 PM
  Subject: [neat] Phenotype XML


  Colin and all,

 =
 Okay...here's my suggested format for network XML. 
  (I'm using Colin's r=
ecent recurrent XOR network as an
  example):

  <network>
    <title>Colin=
's XOR Network</title> 
    <neuron id=3D"0" type=3D"in" hint-layer=3D"1"
 =
 hint-position=3D"1" /> 
    <neuron id=3D"1" type=3D"in" hint-layer=3D"1"
=
  hint-position=3D"2" /> 
    <neuron id=3D"2" type=3D"in" hint-layer=3D"1"=

  hint-position=3D"3" /> 
    <neuron id=3D"3" type=3D"out" hint-layer=3D"=
2"
  hint-position=3D"1" /> 
    <connection id=3D"4" src-id=3D"0" tgt-id=
=3D"3"
  recurrent=3D"false" weight=3D"1.64327624043105" /> 
    <connectio=
n id=3D"5" src-id=3D"1" tgt-id=3D"3"
  recurrent=3D"false" weight=3D"-3.301=
7311279049" /> 
    <connection id=3D"6" src-id=3D"2" tgt-id=3D"3"
  recurr=
ent=3D"false" weight=3D"-3.3025163810043" /> 
    <connection id=3D"7" src-=
id=3D"3" tgt-id=3D"3"
  recurrent=3D"true" weight=3D"-7.44947553716588" /> =

    </network>

  Neurons need to have a layer designation, denoted by
  t=
he "hint-layer" attribute, and a position within that
  layer, denoted by t=
he "hint-position" attribute.  This
  way, you can use whatever logic you l=
ike to place
  neurons in any given layer and position, and the XSL
  style=
 sheet can just handle laying them out and
  graphing them.

  Note that co=
nnections need to have an id, as well as a
  "recurrent" attribute.

  I'll=
 write a second XSL style sheet to handle the
  transformation from this XM=
L into a form that my
  current style sheet can parse into an SVG image. 
 =
 Again, all you'll need to do is make sure your XML is
  in the above forma=
t, that all the files are in the
  same directory, that you have Xalan and =
an SVG plug-in
  installed, and then type "draw [xml-filename]".

  Just wo=
ndering...Colin and Ken have expressed an
  interest in using these tools. =
 Anyone else?

  Derek

  __________________________________
  Do you Yahoo=
!?
  Yahoo! Finance Tax Center - File online. File on time.
  http://taxes.=
yahoo.com/filing.html


---------------------------------------------------=
---------------------------
  Yahoo! Groups Links

    a.. To visit your gr=
oup on the web, go to:
    http://groups.yahoo.com/group/neat/
      
    b=
.. To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
    neat-unsubscribe@y=
ahoogroups.com
      
    c.. Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Y=
ahoo! Terms of Service.
